people.title: Bhiwandi Building Collapse Live Updates: 2 more bodies recovered from debris, death toll rises to 8
people.discription: Maharashtra recorded 177 new Covid cases on Monday, a significant drop from the 425 new cases recorded a day earlier, taking the state's tally to 8166068. The active tally in the state is 3932 cases as of Monday, a health department statement said.

people.title: Centre blocks 14 mobile messenger apps being used by terrorist groups
people.author: ANI
people.discription: The Union Government instructed service providers to ban 14 applications in Jammu and Kashmir, following recommendations by the Ministry of Home Affairs, officials said. Most of the apps are communication platforms that allow encrypted messaging,

people.title: Imran Khan's PTI will be 'ultimate loser' if talks on polls fail: Pakistan government
people.author: PTI
people.discription: Terming "impracticable" Imran Khan's demand that the National Assembly be dissolved by May 14 for a successful outcome of talks, Pakistan's ruling coalition has warned the former Premier that his party will be the "ultimate loser"

people.title: Indian job market to see 22% churn in 5 yrs; AI, machine learning among top roles: WEF
people.author: PTI
people.discription: The Indian job market is estimated to witness 22% churn over the next five years, with top emerging roles coming from AI, machine learning and data segments, a new study showed on May 1.
people.__EMPTY: Globally, the job market churn is estimated at 23%, with 69 million new jobs expected to be created and 83 million eliminated by 2027, the World Economic Forum said in its latest Future of Jobs report.

people.title: Man Dies After Falling Into Vessel Of Boiling Rasam At Tamil Nadu Wedding
people.author: Tamil Nadu NewsPress Trust of India
people.discription: The victim was a college student who was working part-time in a catering firm and was serving food to guests at a wedding function.

people.title: Caught On CCTV: 6 Men Part Of Fresh Strike By Maharashtra's 'Machete Gang'
people.author: Pune NewsReported by Sunilkumar Singh, Edited by Aditi Gautam
people.discription: A group of six men carrying koytas or machetes attacked the staff of a medical shop in Maharashtra's Pimpri-Chinchwad on Saturday, the police said.
people.__EMPTY: The video of the incident has gone viral on social media.
people.__EMPTY_1: The men enter the medical shop carrying machetes and attack a staff member, the video shows.

people.author: Kirubhakar Purushothaman

politics.title: Don’t listen to people who say BJP does not need votes of Muslims, says ex-MP Syed Zafar Islam
politics.author: THE HINDU BUREAU
politics.discription: BJP’s national spokesperson and former Rajya Sabha member Syed Zafar Islam clarified that the statement by some BJP functionaries that they do not need the votes of Muslims should not be taken seriously as it is not the view of the party.

politics.title: Congress dubs 100th episode of Modi’s radio programme as maun ki baat
politics.author: THE HINDU BUREAU
politics.discription: As Prime Minister Narendra Modi completed the 100th episode of Mann Ki Baat on April 30, the Congress took a dig at Mr. Modi for being “ maun” [silent] on key issues such as China, Adani, increasing economic inequalities and the wrestlers’ protest.

politics.title: Uzbekistan votes on changes that extend President's tenure, promise human rights reform
politics.author: AP
politics.discription: Voters in Uzbekistan, the most populous former Soviet Central Asian republic, cast ballots on April 30 in a referendum on a revised Constitution that promises human rights reforms but that also would allow the country's President to stay in office until 2040.

politics.title: "Learn From My Brother": Priyanka Gandhi On PM's "Abused 91 Times" Charge
politics.author: India NewsPress Trust of India
politics.discription: Jamkhandi (Karnataka): Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Sunday reacted on Prime Minister Narendra Modi's statement about verbal abuse, saying one has to take such attacks in their stride in public life, and counselled him to learn from her

politics.title: "Heart-Warming": Law Minister's Big Praise For Chief Justice's Order
politics.author: India NewsPress Trust of India
politics.discription: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Sunday praised an order of the Supreme Court allowing a judicial services aspirant suffering from writer's cramp to get a scribe to write his preliminary examination for the recruitment of civil judges in Uttarakhand.

politics.title: Congress working president Satish Jarkiholi: ‘None of us are in the CM race. Only Siddaramaiah and D K Shivakumar are’
politics.author: Akram M
politics.discription: "SCs, STs who have backed Congress over the years... they won't shift overnight due to new quota policy... Similarly, those who think BJP policies have helped them, will not return to Congress immediately," says Satish Jarkiholi.

politics.title: More women voters than men in half of Karnataka Assembly seats
politics.author: Harikishan Sharma , Damini Nath
politics.discription: The number of Assembly constituencies in Karnataka where women voters outnumber men has jumped to 112 – or 50% of the total 224 seats – from 67 (30%) in 2018, according to the latest electoral rolls data.

planet.title: Forest Officer Shares Incredible Video Of Tiger Making Way For Herd Of Elephants
planet.author: OffbeatEdited by Anjali Thakur
planet.discription: It's true tigers are apex predators but even they don't like to mess with elephants. A video shared by Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Susanta Nanda shows a tiger making way for a herd of elephants in a jungle.

planet.title: Earth in hot water? Worries over sudden ocean warming spike
planet.author: AP
planet.discription: The world's oceans have suddenly spiked much hotter and well above record levels in the last few weeks, with scientists trying to figure out what it means and whether it forecasts a surge in atmospheric warming.
